title: Branding
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is a YouTube Game of the Week scheduled

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the game cell will be appropriately labeled as such (at the top of the cell)
and the label will be displayed similarly to the MLB.TV Game of the Day label text
English: "Live on YouTube - Watch Free"
Spanish: "YouTube En Vivo - Ver Gratis"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to the MLB.TV EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the game cell will be appropriately labeled as such (under game matchup text)
and the label will be displayed similarly to the MLB.TV Game of the Day label text
English: "Live on YouTube - Watch Free"
Spanish: "YouTube En Vivo - Ver Gratis"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to the team page of a team featured in the YouTube Game of the Week
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the game cell will be appropriately labeled as such (at the top right of the schedule snapshot)
and the label will be displayed similarly to the MLB.TV Game of the Day label text
English: "Live on YouTube - Watch Free"
Spanish: "YouTube En Vivo - Ver Gratis"

title: .TV links
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is a YouTube Game of the Week scheduled

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
and expands the game cell of the YouTube Game of the Week
and the game feed is live
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a TV link for the feed
and it will be labeled "YouTube"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Team Page of a team featured in the YouTube Game of the Week
and the game feed is live
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a TV link in the schedule module's game detail section
and it will be labeled "YouTube"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the MLB.TV EPG
and expands the game cell of the YouTube Game of the Week
and the game feed is live
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a TV link for the feed
and it will be labeled "YouTube"

title: Team Page Embed
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is a YouTube Game of the Week with a live feed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to the team page of a team featured in a live YouTube Game of the Week
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will view the live feed autoplaying in an embedded player at the top of the page
and the video will automatically be muted

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to the team page of a team featured in a live YouTube Game of the Week
and the video is playing in an embedded player at the top
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then all other team view elements should be pushed when the video embed is active
and they must retain their standard functionality

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to the team page of a team featured in a live YouTube Game of the Week
and Hide Scores is OFF
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video in the embedded player should play at the live point

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to the team page of a team featured in a live YouTube Game of the Week
and Hide Scores is ON
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video in the embedded player should start playing at the beginning

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing a live YouTube Game feed in the embedded player 
and taps on the player to bring up the player controls
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see buttons for play/pause, mute, fullscreen, and closed captioning

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user brings up the player controls on a live YouTube Game feed in the embedded player
and taps on the Pause button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the live feed will pause

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the live YouTube Game feed in the embedded player is paused
and the user taps the Play button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the live feed will resume

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user brings up the player controls on a live YouTube Game feed in the embedded player
and taps on the fullscreen button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will begin playing in fullscreen mode

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the live YouTube Game video is playing in fullscreen mode 
and the user rotates to portrait
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will continue playing

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user brings up the player controls on a live YouTube Game feed in the embedded player
and taps on the closed captioning button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then closed captioning will begin to display on the video

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the team with a live YouTube Game feed is set as the user's favorite team
and the user navs to the team page via the side navigation
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the embedded video player will be displayed at the top of the team page

title: With YouTube Installed
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is a YouTube Game of the Week with a live feed
AND the user has the YouTube app installed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to the Scoreboard
and expands the game cell of the YouTube Game
and taps the "YouTube" link to launch the game feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the YouTube app
where the game feed will launch

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to a Team Page of a team featured in the YouTube Game
and taps the "YouTube" link in the game detail section to launch the game feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the YouTube app
where the game feed will launch

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to the TV EPG
and taps the YouTube Game to launch the game feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the YouTube app
where the game feed will launch

title: Without YouTube Enabled
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is a YouTube Game of the Week with a live feed
AND the user DOES NOT have the YouTube app Enabled (Settings > Apps > YouTube > Disable)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to the Scoreboard
and expands the game cell of the YouTube Game
and taps the "YouTube" link to launch the game feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to a webview in which they can watch the feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to a Team Page of a team featured in the YouTube Game
and taps the "YouTube" link in the game detail section to launch the game feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to a webview in which they can watch the feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to the TV EPG
and taps the YouTube Game to launch the game feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to a webview in which they can watch the feed

title: At Bat Entitlements/Blackouts
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is a YouTube Game of the Week with a live feed
AND the user has the YouTube app installed

custom_steps_separated.content: When a LITE user attempts to launch the YouTube Game from At Bat
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the YouTube app
where the game feed will launch

custom_steps_separated.content: When a PAID user attempts to launch the YouTube Game from At Bat
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the YouTube app
where the game feed will launch

custom_steps_separated.content: When a Single Team user attempts to launch the YouTube Game from At Bat
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the YouTube app
where the game feed will launch

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user attempts to launch the YouTube Game from At Bat
and one of teams featured is a local team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will not receive any sort of blackout messaging in At Bat
and will be taken to the YouTube app

title: Archives in At Bat
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is a YouTube Game of the Week scheduled

custom_steps_separated.content: When the YouTube Game is flipped to media_archive
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the archive will become available in the At Bat app

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the YouTube Game is flipped to media_archive
and the user navs to the TV EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game will NOT be labeled with the YouTube-specific text

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the YouTube Game is flipped to media_archive
and the user navs to the TV EPG
and taps to expand the game cell for the YouTube Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the feed button will NOT be labeled with the YouTube-specific text

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the YouTube Game is flipped to media_archive
and the user navs to the Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game will NOT be labeled with the YouTube-specific text

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the YouTube Game is flipped to media_archive
and the user navs to the team page of a team featured in the YouTube Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game will NOT be labeled with the YouTube-specific text

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the YouTube Game is flipped to media_archive
and the user navs to the team page of a team featured in the YouTube Game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will NOT be an embedded player appearing at the top of the team page

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user attempts to launch the archive from At Bat
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the archive will follow At Bat requirements in regards to archive entitlements & blackouts:

- TV-entitled users can playback
- At Bat users will be gated by TV paywall with specific messaging
- Lite users will be gated by TV paywall
- Single Team users will only be able to view if their team had played
- No blackouts
